repository.corpname: Columbia UniversityRare Book and Manuscript Library,

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: Georges Borchardt, a literary agent, began representing French publishing firms in New York during the early 1950s. Later, he also acted for individual French authors who were seeking American publication. Eventually he handled American and English authors as well. With his wife, Anne Bolton Borchordt, he formed Borchardt, Inc. Literary Agency in 1968. His clients have included Flammarion, Gallimard, Denoël, Albert Camus, Jean Giraudoux, Julien Green, Jean-Paul Sartre, Stanley Elkin, and Elie Wiesel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, royalty statements, literary manuscripts and contracts. Among the cataloged correspondents are: Hervʹe Bazin, Laurent de Brunhoff, Michel Butor, Marguerite Duras, John Gardner, Meyer Levin, and Pierre Mendès-France.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into 10 series:

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The following boxes are located off-site: 1-419. You will need to request this material from the Rare Book and Manuscript Library at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room.
Permission of Georges Borchardt, Inc. required to examine or photocopy materials.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: 1987 addition: Author agency, and publisher files containing correspondence, contracts, offerings, and royalty statements. English language authors and publishers, 1970-1983. French and other foreign language authors and publishers, 1951-1980. Borchardt, Georges Gift
1989 addition: Includes all series described in 1987 addition covering the years 1957-1984, Series V (D-Coll-1); covering the years 1971-1986, Series VI (D-Coll-1) Borchardt, Georges Gift

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); George Borchardt Records; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library..

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: 1987 addition: Author agency, and publisher files containing correspondence, contracts, offerings, and royalty statements. English language authors and publishers, 1970-1983. French and other foreign language authors and publishers, 1951-1980. Collection updated 06/--/87 LWW
1989 addition: Includes all series described in 1987 addition covering the years 1957-1984, Series V (D-Coll-1); covering the years 1971-1986, Series VI (D-Coll-1) Collection updated 06/--/89 RL

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the collection must be requested from the Curator of Manuscripts/University Archivist, Rare Book and Manuscript Library (RBML). The RBML approves permission to publish that which it physically owns; the responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.
